events.originalText: In the first fatal accident involving a Boeing 777 airliner, Asiana Airlines Flight 214 crashed on final approach to San Francisco International Airport, resulting in three deaths.
events.subtitle: Boeing 777
events.headline: Asiana Airlines Flight 214 crashes on final approach to San Francisco International Airport, resulting in three deaths

events.originalText: Gunmen attacked a secondary school in Mamudo, Yobe State, Nigeria, killing 42 people, mostly students.
events.subtitle: Mamudo school massacre
events.headline: Gunmen attack secondary school in Mamudo, Yobe State, Nigeria, killing 42 people

events.originalText: Jadranka Kosor became the first female prime minister of Croatia.
events.subtitle: Jadranka Kosor
events.headline: Jadranka Kosor becomes first female prime minister of Croatia

events.originalText: The Troubles: In response to the Drumcree conflict, five days of unrest began in nationalist districts of Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Five days of unrest begin in nationalist districts of Northern Ireland in response to Drumcree conflict

events.originalText: A Palestinian Islamic Jihad member carried out a suicide attack by hijacking a bus and forcing it into a ravine near Kiryat Ye'arim, Israel.
events.subtitle: Palestinian Islamic Jihad
events.headline: Palestinian Islamic Jihad member carries out suicide attack near Kiryat Ye'arim, Israel

events.originalText: After visiting several Asian communist countries, Romanian leader Nicolae Ceaușescu gave a speech on a number of neo-Stalinist and socialist-realist ideals, which became known as the July Theses.
events.subtitle: Nicolae Ceaușescu
events.headline: Nicolae Ceaușescu gives speech on neo-Stalinist ideals after visiting Asian communist countries

events.originalText: The Late Late Show, the world's longest-running chat show by the same broadcaster, aired on Irish television for the first time.
events.subtitle: The Late Late Show (Irish talk show)
events.headline: The Late Late Show airs on Irish television for the first time

events.originalText: The United States conducted the Sedan nuclear test as part of Project Plowshare, a program to investigate the use of nuclear explosions for civilian purposes.
events.subtitle: Sedan (nuclear test)
events.headline: United States conducts Sedan nuclear test as part of Project Plowshare

events.originalText: At a concert by the Quarrymen at the St. Peter's Church Woolton Garden fete, band member John Lennon met Paul McCartney, triggering a series of events that led to the forming of the Beatles.
events.subtitle: The Quarrymen
events.headline: John Lennon meets Paul McCartney at Quarrymen concert, leading to formation of the Beatles

events.originalText: Second World War: After a three-month siege, the Italian garrison of Saïo (in modern-day Ethiopia) surrendered to Belgian, British and Ethiopian troops.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Italian garrison of Saïo surrenders to Belgian, British, and Ethiopian troops after three-month siege

events.originalText: The Story Bridge in Brisbane, the longest cantilever bridge in Australia, was opened by Sir Leslie Wilson, Governor of Queensland.
events.subtitle: Story Bridge
events.headline: Story Bridge in Brisbane, Australia, opened by Sir Leslie Wilson, Governor of Queensland

events.originalText: A major breach of the Manchester Bolton & Bury Canal (pictured) in England sent millions of gallons of water cascading 300 feet (90 m) into the River Irwell.
events.subtitle: Manchester Bolton & Bury Canal
events.headline: Major breach of Manchester Bolton & Bury Canal sends millions of gallons of water into River Irwell

events.originalText: First World War: Russian troops won a victory in the Battle of Kostiuchnówka, with the Polish Legions playing a key role on the Austro-Hungarian side.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Russian troops win Battle of Kostiuchnówka in First World War

events.originalText: Napoleon's French forces defeated Archduke Charles' Austrian army at the Battle of Wagram, the decisive confrontation of the War of the Fifth Coalition.
events.subtitle: Napoleon
events.headline: Napoleon's French forces defeat Archduke Charles' Austrian army at Battle of Wagram

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: A Royal Navy squadron failed to eliminate a smaller French Navy squadron at Algeciras before they could join their Spanish allies.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: Royal Navy squadron fails to eliminate smaller French Navy squadron at Algeciras

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: American troops at Fort Ticonderoga in New York completed a retreat from advancing British forces, causing an uproar in the American public.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: American troops complete retreat from Fort Ticonderoga in New York

events.originalText: Troops loyal to James II of England defeated those of James Scott, 1st Duke of Monmouth at the Battle of Sedgemoor, the final battle of the Monmouth Rebellion.
events.subtitle: James II of England
events.headline: Troops loyal to James II of England defeat James Scott, 1st Duke of Monmouth at Battle of Sedgemoor

events.originalText: The Ottoman Empire made a final attempt to conquer the island of Malta, but were repulsed by the Knights Hospitaller.
events.subtitle: Ottoman Empire
events.headline: Ottoman Empire repulsed in final attempt to conquer Malta by Knights Hospitaller

events.originalText: The last monarch of the House of York and the Plantagenet dynasty, Richard III (pictured), was crowned King of England.
events.subtitle: House of York
events.headline: Richard III crowned King of England, last monarch of House of York and Plantagenet dynasty
